alert.note: Alert for Scotland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 5:10PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Scotland County through 615 PM EDT... At 509 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Laurinburg. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Laurinburg, Maxton and East Laurinburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
